test.question:
Danny worked 40 hours and earned $6.30 per hour. His friend Erica earned $8.40 per hour at her job.

 How many hours would Erica have to work in order to equal Danny's earnings for 40 hours?
If the measure of angle CAD = 40, what is the measure of angle DCB?
The number of students in a class is x. One day, 5 students were absent. What fractional part of the class was present?

The gauge on a water tank shows that the tank is 1/3 full of water. In order to fill the tank, 16 gallons of water are added.

 How many gallons of water does the tank hold when full?
What is the length in feet of the ramp?
At a luncheon, 48 half-pints of fruit juice are served. What is the cost, at $3.50 per gallon, of these servings of fruit juice?
Which of the following give(s) a complete solution of the equation?
What is the perimeter of the figure?
A rectangular dining room has a floor area of 322 square feet. If the length of the room is 23 feet, what is the perimeter?
What is the perimeter of the figure?

Henry has $5 more than Oliver, and the same amount of money as Murray. Together, they have $85.

 How much money does Oliver have?
How much tax is due on a taxable income of $5,800?

A bed and breakfast charges $48.00 per day for a double room. In addition, there is 5% tax.

 How much does a couple pay for several days stay?

A plastic pipe, 5 feet 9 inches long, is cut into three equal pieces. Assuming no waste when the cuts are made, what is the length of each piece?
By how many dollars do the sales in the meat department exceed the sales in the dairy department?

A box of cereal is priced at x cents per box. A customer has a coupon for 15 cents off. If the store reduces prices by doubling the value of each coupon, how much, in cents, does the customer pay for the box of cereal?

The measures of the angles of a triangle are in the ratio 3:2:1.

 What is the measure of the largest angle of the triangle?
If 1 = 36 and 2 = 2(3), then 3 equals
Ms. Klein bought 4 pounds of beef and 3(1/2) pounds of chicken for $13.98. If the beef cost $2.76 per pound, what was the cost of the chicken per pound?
How many dollars were spent for labor?
A bag contains 12 red, 3 blue, 6 green, and 4 yellow marbles. If a marble is drawn from the bag at random, what is the probability that the marble will be either blue or yellow?
What is the slope of the line passing through points A (5,4) and B (0,3)?

To measure the distance (DC) across a pond, a surveyor takes points A and B so that AB is parallel to DC.

 If AB = 60 feet, EB= 48 feet, and ED= 80 feet, find DC.
The graph shows what happens to each $100 taken in by a small business. How many dollars out of each $100 taken in represent profit?

Nick scored 7 more points than Josh in a basketball game. Paul scored 2 points less than Josh in the same game.

 If the three boys scored a total of 38 points, how many points did Josh score?

A box in the form of a rectangle solid has a square base 5 feet in length and a height of h feet.

 If the volume of the rectangular solid is 200 cubic feet, which of the following equations may be used to find h?
Which point on the number line represents the closest approximation to the square root of 12?
The diagram represents a large living room. What is the area, in square yards, of the room?
